bug.author: photi
bug.summary: TypeError: object supporting the buffer API required
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
TypeError: object supporting the buffer API required File "/Users/photisgeorgiades/anaconda3/envs/Anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/streamlit/ScriptRunner.py", line 306, in _run_script exec(code, module.dict) File "/Users/photisgeorgiades/anaconda3/envs/Anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/streamlit/hello.py", line 334, in run() File "/Users/photisgeorgiades/anaconda3/envs/Anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/streamlit/hello.py", line 308, in run demo() File "/Users/photisgeorgiades/anaconda3/envs/Anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/streamlit/hello.py", line 78, in mapping_demo "data": from_data_file("bike_rental_stats.json"), File "/Users/photisgeorgiades/anaconda3/envs/Anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/streamlit/caching.py", line 544, in wrapped_func return get_or_set_cache() File "/Users/photisgeorgiades/anaconda3/envs/Anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/streamlit/caching.py", line 509, in get_or_set_cache code_hasher.update(func) File "/Users/photisgeorgiades/anaconda3/envs/Anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/streamlit/hashing.py", line 185, in update self._update(self.hasher, obj, context) File "/Users/photisgeorgiades/anaconda3/envs/Anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/streamlit/hashing.py", line 217, in _update hasher.update(b) <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
'Mapping Demo' <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: (get it with $ streamlit version) Python version: (get it with $ python --version) Python 3.7.4 (default, Aug 13 2019, 15:17:50) [Clang 4.0.1 (tags/RELEASE_401/final)] :: Anaconda, Inc. on darwin OS version: MacOs High Sierra 10.13.6 Browser version: Safari Version 13.0.1

comments.comment:
Hi there! This looks like a dupe of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/242>#242</denchmark-link> . The fix is coming soon with PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/254>#254</denchmark-link>
(Closing this as a duplicate. Please reopen if you think this is not right)
FYI, this also happens if you call decoarted functions from the ipython REPL: import streamlit as st @st.cache def f(x): print(f'hello {x}') return x f(1) f(1) f(1) f(1) f(2)
Or just the REPL in general. TypeError: object supporting the buffer API required
